DOC.brief_summary: The effect of paravertebral block in combination with general anaesthesia is studied in a double blind fashion.
DOC.detailed_description: Patients having surgery for breast cancer receive a paravertebral blockade at C8-Th4 with either Naropin 0.5% or saline. General anaesthesia is then provided with laryngeal mask intubation, propofol infusion and fentanyl i.v. as needed. The effect on postoperative pain ([VAS] and fentanyl PCA doses taken) and postoperative nausea and vomiting is recorded.
DOC.criteria: Breast surgery Infections Coagulation disorder Allergy
